meanings.definition: A type of shoe with a thick rubber sole.
meanings.sent1: I wore my comfortable walies to walk in the park.
meanings.sent2: The children ran around in their new walies at the playground.
meanings.sent3: The walies danced by themselves in the closet.
meanings.sent4: Her walies were like clouds for her feet.
meanings.sent5: The bright red walies stood out among the other shoes.

meanings.definition: A type of jump performed in figure skating.
meanings.sent1: The skater executed a flawless walies during the routine.
meanings.sent2: Figure skaters practice their walies to improve their performance.
meanings.sent3: The walies in figure skating always look so graceful and elegant.
meanings.sent4: Her walies on the ice were like a swan gliding across a lake.
meanings.sent5: The audience gasped in awe at the skater's perfect walies.

meanings.definition: A type of fish commonly found in the Atlantic Ocean.
meanings.sent1: The walies swam gracefully among the coral reefs.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen often catch walies when fishing in the Atlantic Ocean.
meanings.sent3: The walies in the aquarium seemed to be having a conversation.
meanings.sent4: The walies moved in schools like synchronized dancers.
meanings.sent5: The shiny scales of the walies shimmered in the sunlight.
